instance.context:
A visiting card , also known as a calling card , is a small paper card with
one 's name printed on it , and often bearing an artistic design . In 18th century Europe , the footmen of aristocrats and royalty would deliver these first European visiting cards to the servants of their prospective hosts solemnly introducing the arrival of their owners .

the act of throwing_out a useless
card or of failing to follow_suit ;

an unattended machine ( outside some banks ) that dispenses money when a personal coded
card is used ;

compass in the form of a
card that rotates so that 0 degrees or North points to magnetic_north ;

computer_circuit consisting of an electronic sub-assembly ; copper conductors are laminated on an insulating board or
card and circuit components are inserted into holes and dip_soldered ;

display consisting of a printed
card with letters and numbers in lines of decreasing size ; used to test visual_acuity ;

a
card used with a time_clock to record an employee's starting and quitting times each day ;

the managers presented their
cards to the umpire at home plate ;

a library_catalog in which each publication is described on a separate file
card ;

a
card recording an employee's starting and quitting times each work_day ;

you have to turn in your
card to get a handicap ;

they sent us a
card from Miami ;

a
card with words or numbers or pictures that is flashed to a class by the teacher ;

automatic_data_processing by electronic means without the use of tabulating
cards or punched tapes ;

any of 32 horizontal directions indicated on the
card of a compass ;

a small piece_of_paper that is supposed to be removed when a hole is punched in a
card or paper_tape ;
